meanings.sent1: She precised her essay to meet the word limit.
meanings.sent2: He always precised his notes before exams.
meanings.sent3: The teacher precised the instructions so the students wouldn't get confused.
meanings.sent4: The editor precised the article to fit the magazine's space constraints.
meanings.sent5: He precised his speech to make it more impactful.

meanings.definition: (Of a person or their manner of speaking) using very few words.
meanings.sent1: Her precised response left no room for confusion.
meanings.sent2: The precised speaker captivated the audience with his succinct delivery.
meanings.sent3: The precised instructions were like a breath of fresh air in the long meeting.
meanings.sent4: His precised style of writing was admired by all.
meanings.sent5: The precised message resonated deeply with the listeners.
